content:
Sorry for being a bit absent recently. I'll start a new job in a new town next month and currently have some real life administrative stuff to do. I still try to get in a round of review once a week.

What also fell under the table yesterday was the biweekly clippy->rust sync. @Eduardo Broto can you do this? Otherwise I'll try to do it this evening.
Of course, I'll take care of it this afternoon
For some reason bors is ignoring me in the Rustup PR I need to open before syncing :thinking:

It seems it was a general problem with bors. It's fixed now :tada:

I'll finish the sync later.

@Eduardo Broto you may have to run cargo update -p clippy after the sync and update the Cargo.lock file. Please put the lock file update (if necessary) in a separate commit. The PR should then be accepted with rollup=never
#78310 (took a while to build :sweat_smile:)
If there is anything I can do to help, I'm happy to help.

@Takayuki Nakata issue triage would be really helpful. This mainly includes answering questions, labeling (with @rustbot) and finding duplicate issues. Sometimes it also involves asking questions, like if the OP has a minimal example if not provided or similar.
I promise to do a round of review tomorrow. I was pinged twice only today from different PRs.

Alright, I'm down to 38 notification, after reviewing all my assigned PRs and PRs I was mentioned in. Since I fully trust the other reviewers, I won't look at PRs I'm not assigned to or (team) mentioned in, in the future. So if you have questions, please ping me.

@Takayuki Nakata What's also really helpful is PR triage. So if there is no reaction from the PR author OR PR reviewer for about 2 weeks, comment with Ping from triage @culprit. <Question about the plan on how to move forward>?.
Thanks for your comments! I'll do that.

If the author has not responded to a previous ping and more than 2 weeks have passed with no activity, should I inform someone on the clippy team to close PR. For example, https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-clippy/pull/5896
Thanks! Yes, that would be great.

Philipp Krones said:

Alright, I'm down to 38 notification, after reviewing all my assigned PRs and PRs I was mentioned in. Since I fully trust the other reviewers, I won't look at PRs I'm not assigned to or (team) mentioned in, in the future. So if you have questions, please ping me.

Takayuki Nakata What's also really helpful is PR triage. So if there is no reaction from the PR author OR PR reviewer for about 2 weeks, comment with Ping from triage @culprit. <Question about the plan on how to move forward>?.

Hi @Philipp Krones , do you still need another help for PR triage? i can help if its only requires pair of eyes

PR and issue triage would be really helpful, more eyes means less work for each person. PR triage is easier, since it requires only pinging the author/reviewer. Issue triage also requires some knowledge of Clippy to answer questions or write short mentoring instructions (or labeling issues).
can help with PR/issue triage if needed
I'm gonna help too (only if i'm sure about what i'm saying :laughing: )

btw, do we need special permissions to set labels?
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-clippy/issues/5827
After clippy#6225 is merged everyone should be able to modify any label (except hacktoberfest) with @rustbot.

I set the labels in clippy#5827 by hand. FYI: GitHub lets you set message templates, which can be accessed with Ctrl-.->Ctrl-[1-9]: https://github.com/settings/replies This may be interesting for rustbot labeling for often used labels.

image.png

Now even GitHub complains about my notifications from Clippy, I didn't get to (yet) . :smiley:
Noticed it as well even though I cleanup notifications every day.
